#summary How to fix certain problems by yourself.
#labels Restrict-View-Commit

= Google Chrome =

== 1. Make sure you have the latest version of Google Chrome installed ==

 # Click on the Wrench -> About Google Chrome
 # If available click on "Update now" or get the latest version from www.google.com/chrome

<br>

== 2. Make sure you have the latest version of !AdBlock installed ==

 # Look which version the latest version is by going to the [http://www.google.com AdBlock Changelog Wiki]
 # Open the Extensions tab by going to this site: chrome://extensions/
 # If you have an older version click on the right top on "Developer mode"
 # Click on "Update extensions now" and wait for a few seconds or try again until it updates

<br>

== 3. Reboot your computer ==
<br>

== 4. Uninstall and reinstall !AdBlock ==

  === Uninstall ===
   # Open the Extensions tab by going to this site: chrome://extensions/
   # Click "Uninstall" on !AdBlock
   # optional, but sometimes helpful: Quit Chrome and reopen it or even reboot your computer now

  === Reinstall ===
   # Go to www.chromeadblock.com
   # Click on "Install" and install !AdBlock for Chrome

<br>

== 5. Delete the !LocalStorage file of !AdBlock ==

  === Windows ===
   # Quit Chrome
   # Open Windows Explorer
   # Go to: %localappdata%\google\chrome\user data\default\Local Storage
   # Delete the "chrome-extension_gighmmpiobklfepjocnamgkkbiglidom_0.localstorage" file
   # Open Chrome again and see if !AdBlock works

  === Mac OS X ===
   # Quit Chrome
   # Open a Finder window by clicking on the Finder
   # Go to: !YourUsername -> Library ->Application Support -> Google -> Chrome -> Default -> Local Storage
   # Delete the "chrome-extension_gighmmpiobklfepjocnamgkkbiglidom_0.localstorage" file
   # Open Chrome again and see if !AdBlock works

<br><br>
----
<br>

= Safari =

== 1. Make sure you have the latest version of Safari installed ==

 # If you are using Windows click on Help -> About Safari or if you are using Mac OS X click on Safari -> About Safari
 # You can get the latest version here: http://www.apple.com/safari/download/

<br>

== 2. Make sure you have the latest version of !AdBlock installed ==

 # Open the Safari preferences
 # Go to: Extensions -> Updates
 # Wait a few seconds and install the update if there is one

  === Enable autoupdate for extensions ===
   # Open the Safari preferences
   # Go to: Extensions -> Updates
   # Enable autoupdates by clicking on the "Automatically install extension updates" checkbox  

<br>

== 3. Reboot your computer ==
<br>

== 4. Uninstall and reinstall !AdBlock ==
  
  === Uninstall ===
   # Open the Safari preferences
   # Go to: Extensions -> !AdBlock
   # Click "Uninstall"
   # optional, but sometimes helpful: Quit Safari and reopen it or even reboot your computer now

  === Reinstall ===
   # Download !AdBlock for Safari from www.safariadblock.com
   # Click on the downloaded file and install !AdBlock for Safari 

<br>

== 5. Delete the !LocalStorage file of !AdBlock ==

  === Windows ===
   # Quit Safari
   # Open Windows Explore
   # Go to: %localappdata%\Apple Computer\Safari\!LocalStorage
   # Delete the "safari-extension_com.betafish.adblockforsafari-(letters & numbers).localstorage" file(s)
   # Open Safari again and see if !AdBlock works

  === Mac OS X ===
   # Quit Safari
   # Open a Finder window by clicking on the Finder
   # Go to: !YourUsername -> Library -> Safari -> !LocalStorage
   # Delete the "safari-extension_com.betafish.adblockforsafari-(letters & numbers).localstorage" file(s)
   # Open Safari again and see if !AdBlock works
